column4: How can I put back all the files from trash to the original location?
open the trash, select all. Right click and restore should put them back where they were...
well this is what i found: a dual-boot machine that suddenly windows stop workking with NTldr not found
and i found all those files on the .Trash-1000
You need to reinstall ntldr, using. E.g. recovery console
with testdisk right?
You'll need ms recovery console, or if using windows 7 the startup recovery should do the trick for you from the install cd
this is windows xp
hmmm, of all the files in the trash do you see ntldr there by any chance?
in the old c:\ there is only autoexec.bat
Sounds like you'll need to do a reinstall of xp in that case. Unfortunate...
I found this guide: http://ubuntuguide.net/fix-windows-when-boot-files-bootinintldrare-missing
my main worry is to put all the files back to the right places within windows
so are all the files in your ubuntu trash the files from your original ntfs partition?
I go to the ntfs partition and ctrl + h to see the .Trash-1000
expunged files and info is there
in files looks like the whole windows tree
arrrcanum42: I wonder if I should use restore-tras command for this
ok, so you should just be able to 'mv * ../' while you're in that directory
so what is the meaning of info + expunged?
I believe that's how GNU/Linux handles it's recycle bin
ie. Those directories should contain information about where the files were originally located, for example
